p: Mortality was recorded in 8% of the IP-injected goldfish at 16 and 17 days pc. In moribund fish, petechial haemorrhages in the skin and the base of the fins, as well as skin ulcerations, were observed ( Figure 3). Post-mortem examinations of an IP-injected moribund goldfish showed oedematous changes in the liver and ascites in the abdominal cavity. Post-mortem examinations of asymptomatic goldfish showed an enlarged spleen in 30% and 1% of the fish sampled at 10- and 20-days pc, respectively.
